original_title: Not Even Nothing Can Be Free of Ghosts
overview: Rainer Kohlbergerâ€™s abstract film was created entirely without a camera. Through digital algorithms, he precisely arranged a rhythm of light and shadow that pulsates off the screen into our physical space with blinding intensity. The presence of light is almost felt as we are sucked into the image to become its ghostly accomplice. As we leave the theatre, the optical vibrations continue to haunt us.
title: Not Even Nothing Can Be Free of Ghosts
